venue.name: Tuscano Ristorante at Gotham Citi Cafe

item.description:
This informal community-wide party will celebrate the launch of The Big Read-New Haven, a festival of reading around Harper Lee's "To Kill a Mocking Bird". "To Kill a Mockingbird" was chosen because of the powerful themes it presents: racial prejudice, economic disparity, and justice and their relevance to the future of our community, our state and the wider world. Over 50 community organizations have joined together to reach all 123,000 of New Haven's citizens through an eight-week series of events and activities devoted to Mockingbird such as panel discussions, essay contests, reading circles, classroom projects, film screenings, theatrical readings and unique events aimed at non-reader audiences, but with a special focus on those 35 years and under. The program will conclude with a series of features
performances, panels and special events on the New Haven Green during our June 2007 Festival.

Proceeds from the Black & White Ball will be used to purchase books and materials for the Big Read.

Informal black and white attire suggested. Bring a new or gently used copy of "To Kill a Mockingbird" and receive a free drink voucher.

Tickets are $15 in advance or $25 at the door. Call the Shubert Box Office at (203) 562-5666 or go to www.artidea.org for more information.

Your contact for this event is Diana: (860) 857-3894. **Please note that this event begins at 8pm but that Diana will not arrive until between 8:30 and 9pm.**
item.name: Fri. 4/13 - The Big Read's Black & White Ball
